title.narrative: South Asia Subregional Economic Cooperation Power System Expansion Project

description.narrative: ADB assisted the Government of Nepal in increasing capacity of national power grid and enhancing renewable energy development. The South Asia Subregional Economic Cooperation Power System Expansion Project is building more than 200 kilometers of power transmission lines, as well as substations, along Kali Gandaki corridor in the Himalayas and Marsyangdi-Kathmandu route. The project is also building or upgrading more than 1,000 kilometers of power distribution lines in the east, central, and west regions of the country. To bring affordable renewable energy to remote areas, the project is building small hydroelectric power plants, as well as mini-grid based solar and solar/wind hybrid energy systems.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Science, Technology and Environment

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Power evacuation capacity from Kali Gandaki basin and Marsyangdi basin increased to 1,000 MW by 2021 (Baseline: 100 MW in2013)

description.narrative: Increased capacity of national grid and enhanced renewable energy development

title.narrative: Distribution capacities in identified areas increased to 316 MVA by 2021 (Baseline: 100 MVA in 2011)
